Providers¶

Google App Engine OpenID Providers¶

This module provides OpenID Providers based on Google App Engine Users API library.

Note

When using these providers the user object will always have only the user_id, email, gae_user attributes populated with data. Moreover the user_id will always be empty on the Development Server.

GAEOpenID(*args, **kwargs) OpenID provider based on the
Yahoo(*args, **kwargs) GAEOpenID provider with the identifier predefined to "me.yahoo.com".
Google(*args, **kwargs) GAEOpenID provider with the identifier predefined to
class authomatic.providers.gaeopenid.GAEOpenID(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

OpenID provider based on the Google App Engine Users API library.

__init__(*args, identifier='')¶

Accepts additional keyword argument identifier, the OpenID claimed identity to authenticate.

class authomatic.providers.gaeopenid.Yahoo(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

GAEOpenID provider with the identifier predefined to "me.yahoo.com".

class authomatic.providers.gaeopenid.Google(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

GAEOpenID provider with the identifier predefined to "https://www.google.com/accounts/o8/id".

Base Providers¶

This module provides abstract classes for implementation of protocol specific abstract classes.

login_decorator(func) Decorator to be used by the BaseProvider.login().
BaseProvider(adapter, provider_name[, ...]) Abstract base class for all providers.
AuthorisationProvider(*args, **kwargs) Base provider for authorisation protocols i.e.
AuthenticationProvider(*args, **kwargs) Base provider for authentication protocols i.e.
authomatic.providers.login_decorator(func)¶

Decorator to be used by the BaseProvider.login().

Provides mechanism for error reporting and returning result which makes the BaseProvider.login() implementation cleaner.

class authomatic.providers.BaseProvider(adapter, provider_name, callback=None, report_errors=True, logging_level=20, csrf_generator=None, prefix='authomatic', **kwargs)[source]¶

Abstract base class for all providers.

adapter = None¶

The platform adapter.

name = None¶

str The provider name as specified in the Config.

callback = None¶

callable An optional callback called when the login procedure is finished with core.LoginResult passed as argument.

report_errors = None¶

bool If True exceptions which occur inside the login() will be caught and reported in the core.LoginResult.error.

logging_level = None¶

int The logging level treshold as specified in the standard Python logging library. If None or False there will be no logs. Default is logging.INFO.

prefix = None¶

str Prefix used by storing values to session.

user = None¶

core.User.

has_protected_resources[source]¶

bool Indicates whether the provider supports access to user’s protected resources.

login()[source]¶

Launches the login procedure to get user’s credentials from provider.

Should be decorated with login_decorator(). The login procedure is considered finished when the user attribute is not empty when the method runs out of it’s flow or when there are errors.

classmethod get_type()[source]¶

Returns the provider type.

Returns:str The full dotted path to base class e.g. "authomatic.providers.oauth2.OAuth2".
update_user()[source]¶

Updates and returns user.

Returns:core.User
classmethod csrf_generator()¶

A callable that should generate a random string which is dificult to gues.

class authomatic.providers.AuthorisationProvider(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Base provider for authorisation protocols i.e. protocols which allow a consumer to be authorized by a provider to access protected resources of a user. e.g. OAuth 2.0 or OAuth 1.0a.

has_protected_resources = True¶

Indicates whether the provider supports access to user’s protected resources.

consumer = None¶

core.Consumer

short_name = None¶

Short name as specified in the Config.

user_authorisation_url[source]¶

str URL to which we redirect the user to grant our app i.e. the consumer an authorisation to access his protected resources. see http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-4.1.1 and http://oauth.net/core/1.0a/#auth_step2.

access_token_url[source]¶

str URL where we can get the access token to access protected resources of a user. see http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-4.1.3 and http://oauth.net/core/1.0a/#auth_step3.

user_info_url[source]¶

str URL where we can get the user info. see http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-7 and http://oauth.net/core/1.0a/#anchor12.

to_tuple(credentials)[source]¶

Must convert credentials to a tuple to be used by core.Credentials.serialize().

Warning

Must be a classmethod!

Parameters:credentials (core.Credentials) – core.Credentials
Returns:tuple
reconstruct(deserialized_tuple)[source]¶

Must convert the deserialized_tuple back to core.Credentials.

Warning

Must be a staticmethod or classmethod!

Parameters:deserialized_tuple (tuple) – A tuple which first index is the short_name and the rest are all the items of the tuple created by to_tuple().
create_request(url, method='GET', content_parser=None, response_parser=None)[source]¶

Creates an authorized request to protected resources of a user.

Parameters:
  • url (str) – URL of the protected resource. Can contain query parameters.
  • method (str) – HTTP method of the request.
  • content_parser (callable) – A callable as described in core.Response.content_parser.
  • response_parser (callable) – A callable as described in core.Request.response_parser.
Returns:

core.Request
fetch_user_info()[source]¶

Makes synchronous request to user_info_url and returns the core.UserInfoResponse.

Returns:core.UserInfoResponse
update_user()[source]¶

Updates the user.

Warning

Makes a request to user_info_url!

Returns:core.User
user_info_request[source]¶

Returns an asynchronous request to user_info_url whose get_response() method returns a core.UserInfoResponse.

Returns:core.Request
class authomatic.providers.AuthenticationProvider(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Base provider for authentication protocols i.e. protocols which allow a provider to authenticate a claimed identity of a user. e.g. OpenID.

has_protected_resources = False¶

Indicates whether the provider supports access to user’s protected resources.

identifier = ''¶

str The claimed identity of a user.
